title: Enchanting Delhi
text:
0 
Andy Hayes, the travel blogger and photographer in his recent visit to Delhi, clicked the best pictures of his life so far! According to Andy, India is a photographer's paradise as his quest to take some marvelous photos was complete here! 
Andy Hayes who works in the Oregon State treasury has traveled all the way to India to experience this country and he himself calls the experience, 'Life changing'. He is a wanderlust struck person who finds solace in traveling with stagnancy choking him. He says traveling is never alone if you are traveling with your camera as capturing so many wonders through the lenses is the best thing to do while on a trip. 
Andy Hayes from Oregon found the crowded city of Delhi simple awesome! He was left dumbfounded with the capital's diverse historical background. Red fort had him awestruck with its vast stretch and the Mughal history intrigued him further. His encounter at Jama Masjid was quite similar as he was stupefied when he saw the collective Namaz. That moment was a golden moment for Andy as he clicked a plethora of pictures to add to his collection and memory. It was not only the historical monuments, the authentic North Indian cuisine in Delhi made him swear to come back to this city again! 
He loved the food served in the road side Dhabas and enjoyed the rustic environment of the place to the fullest. He loved the famous stuffed parathas of 'Paranthe Wali Gali' and the taste still lingers in his taste buds! He found lassi to be amazing and intended to take some back along with him because every sip from the glass was heaven like to him! The kebabs, although spicy, could easily be another reason for him to visit Delhi very soon. 
He couldn't afford to miss a trip to Agra - to experience the world's wonder that stands there since centuries, the Taj Mahal. He went out of his way to see Taj Mahal on a full moon night. Andy was well aware of the beauty of Taj Mahal that way, but experiencing it live was an event in his life he swears not to forget. He would soon be back to India very soon and explore all the other states and its hidden wonders. Delhi was enough to make him fall in love with the whole country!
